channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8845] Add integration test for split, online merge, and compaction
item.description: We should add an integration test for online merge to exercise online merging while chaos money kills/restarts region servers, moves regions around. We need to make sure there is no data loss no matter online merge succeeds/fails.
item.summary: Add integration test for split, online merge, and compaction

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Great idea.
A test that does split, merge, confirm-no-data-loss, split, merge, chaos monkey, confirm-no-loss, split, merge, etc., would be excellent
I'd say this a requirement if we want online merge rock solid in 0.96
The patch does what Stack suggested. Need to keep it running for issues to expose.

Looks good overall. A couple of comments:

  • I like it that everything is configurable.
  • Can you please put up a main() as well and implement Tool interface (you can just copy the bits from other integration tests).
  • From a user's perspective for this test, it is not clear perroundOps and perloadRows parameters. Maybe you can extend the javadoc for adding some more info on what does the test do at each iteration.
  • Should we continue inserting data while concurrently splitting merging?

Sure, will add a main and more javadoc.

Should we continue inserting data while concurrently splitting merging?

Sure, I will do that too. Thanks.
Wouldn't it be easier to make Split and merge a chaos monkey action and then we can use all of the other IT tests (Linkedlist and Ingest) ?
That's a good idea.

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12591765/trunk-8845.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 2 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

This message is automatically generated.
I like the Elliott idea. But that would be in addition to this test? (I like the split, verify, merge, verify in this test).

I would think it's instead of. Make IT tests usage of chaos monkey pretty pluggable (HBASE-8928 + More work) and then you use the base tests (bulk load/import tsv/linked list/ingest) to do the verify.

Split -> Verify would be one action.
Merge -> Verify would be one action.

If either of the two action above fail then fail the test (Chaos monkey already fails the job on exception I think).
When you put it like that (merge+verify), I'm with you (instead-of).
I think we should separate split / merge / compaction type of events from kill region server kind of events. CM actions do not verify, and does not cause the tests to fail.
CM actions verify that the servers are restarted correctly. This feels like the same thing. Plus it keeps us from writing the same tests over and over again.

We can have some split/merge/compaction action, which can be used in the data ingestion tool, which does the verification. These actions can be used in this test as well, not through chaos monkey though.

To add on to that the way I think about these tests is that they have two parts.

  1. Data input/output. This part of the job should put data into hbase and check to make sure that it's always there.
  2. Other things running in combination that should not affect the validity of the data.

So that makes it easy to divide. The tests are ways to get data in, and chaos monkey is the thing running on the side that doesn't affect data.

Data Gen/Verify Orthogonal Actions
Load Test Tool Kill Rs
Import TSV Kill RS Holding Meta
Linked list Kill Master
Bulk Load Run Balancer
  Run Compaction
  Take Snapshot
  Restore Snapshot
  Modify CF's
  Pause RS
  Pause Master
  Un-balance region load
  Split
  Merge

I want to be able to run anything from the left column with any number of things from the right. I don't want to have to re-write a test that does the things on the left every time I want a new set of things from the column on the right.
+1 with Elliott's suggestion. I will do it that way if no objection.
Changed the title, to handle compaction in this issue too.
Attached v2. It uses split/merge/compaction as chaos actions as Elliott suggested, so we don't need another new test. These actions are plugged into big linked list, and data ingestion tests.

This message is automatically generated.
why is sleep needed in these actions? also, CHAOS_EVERY_MS name for tests that also use the random-action-every-minute policy is a little bit misleading, maybe it needs a more expressive name

A little sleep after these actions is to give them a chance to roll ahead before another action kicks in. We don't need it?

CHAOS_EVERY_MS is an existing name. Maybe we can use one-minute too.
Should taking snapshot be added as one ChaosMonkey action ?
That's a good idea. Will do in the next patch.
Attached patch v3. Added a snapshot table action, changed the parameter name Sergey mentioned.

lgtm
Any more reviews? If no objection, I can commit it tomorrow.
Looks good to me.

Patch looks good.
My only comment is that, for split/merge and compaction, the verification is implicit, while there is no verification for snapshot table. Although I don't think adding snapshot verification makes sense here, since on some cases, snapshot will fail and we do not want that to cause test failures. While we are at it, should we add flush actions as well?

While we are at it, should we add flush actions as well?

That's ok. Will do. I will also move some actions into separate policies so that they can have a higher chance to run at the same time.

Patch v4: added action to flush a table/region, move one random region;
grouped actions into several policies in some tests so that more actions can run concurrently and in different pace.

New version looks good. It is a nice step towards going for the

{LoadTest, LinkedList, BulkLoad, ...}

x

{CM policies}

route. We can merge the policies under named policies inside CM (like aggressive policy, deterministic policy, etc) and make IT's choices to be configurable from cmd line, but we can do that as a follow up.

+1.
Integrated into trunk and 0.95. Thanks all for the review and discussion.
Nice Jimmy Xiang
